title: A  Double-Blind, Active-Controlled Multi-Center Study of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in Patients With Pancreatic Cancer
officialTitle: A  Double-Blind, Active-Controlled Multi-Center Study of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in Patients With Pancreatic Cancer
sponsor: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
description: This is a  double-blind, active-controlled multi-center study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in patients with Pancreatic Cancer. The study will enroll approximately 112 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 24-81 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Pancreatic Cancer
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1
- Prior treatment with standard therapy
- Life expectancy â‰¥3 months

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
- Brain metastases unless treated and stable
- Prior treatment with similar mechanism of action
- Other active malignancy requiring treatment
